Requirement: 7.5% concentration limit for Moody's Caa, Excess Caa, S&P CCC, Excess CCC
2.5% concentration limit for each of the top 5 obligors, 1.5% limit for non-senior secured
60% concentration limit for Cov-lite loans
5% concentration limit for obligors with total indebtedness below $250,000,000 and above $150,000,000
0% concentration limit for Long Dated Obligations
2.5% concentration limit for Bridge Loans
5% concentration limit for Permitted Non-Loan Assets and Fixed Rate Obligations
10% limit for Delayed Drawdown/Revolving collateral obligations
More than 90% of the collateral obligations are Senior secured loans
10% limit for Participation interest
5% limit for Deferrable obligations
7.5% limit for DIP obligations

SP industry: not more than 10% of the Collateral Principal Amount may consist of Collateral Obligations that are issued by Obligors that belong to any single S&P Industry Classification, except that up to two S&P Industry Classifications may each represent up to 12%, and one other S&P Industry Classification may represent up to 15%, of the Collateral Principal Amount
5% limit for Current pay obligations
5% limit for Payment less frequent than quarterly
20% limit for Discount obligations
Require post-reinvestment purchases have a maturity that is equal to or shorter than the stated maturity of the prepaid/sold obligation
Require each Overcollateralization Test is satisfied after giving effect to each reinvestment
Require Post-Reinvestment Proceeds must be reinvested with the later to occur of (i) 45 days after receipt and (ii) the second determination date to occur after receipt of proceeds
Require Consent of the Majority of the Controlling Class to change Collateral Quality Tests, Concentration Limits, Provisions and Definitions
Require there are no carveouts within the definition of CCC Excess (for example, up to 2% CCCs trading above par)
Require there are no carveouts within the definition of Discount Obligations (such as for CCC Collateral Obligations)
Require a minimum total indebtedness of $150,000,000 for small obligors, with no allowance for exposure to small obligors
Require Distressed Exchange are limited to be 5% at any point in time and 20% cumulatively
Require First Lien Last Out to be treated as second lien loans
Require a Minimum Price for purchases at 50% with a 5% allowance between 50% and 60%
Require the Trading Plan allowance to be 5% with no carve out for Credit Risk sales
Require maturity anti-bar bell restrictions in the Trading Plan: minimum maturity of 6 months, maximum difference of 3 years in average life between the shortest and longest obligations

Require that sale proceeds from selling a workout asset must be counted as principal up to the balance of the defaulted asset that led to the purchase of the workout asset, with no distinction made if principal or interest is used to purchase the workout asset.
Require that interest can only be used to purchase a workout asset if there is sufficient interest to pay all accrued and unpaid interest on all classes of notes
